alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 19 at 9:46PM PST until February 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph, becoming northwest in the afternoon. Strongest winds during Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Central and Eastern Lake County, including Highway 31 north of Paisley and portions of Highway 395 north of Valley Falls. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow could accompany this wind storm, so blowing and drifting snow may reduce visibility to less than a half of a mile at times. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
